title: Print, "Design for Cartouche Forming a Bridge (Horizontal)", 1740
inscribed: On plate, upper right: 5; lower left: de la Joue, in.; lower center: avec privilege du Roy.; lower right: Huquier Sculp.; on sheet (if vertical), upper right: 25
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 134)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A cartouche within a cartouche, forming a curved bridge on which a stag is pursued by two dogs. Below, a waterfall with a dog's head at center. At left, a bucket, fruit, leaves, a goose, and two heads of dogs. At right, a dog's head spouting water, to its right, a large leafy tree.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Design for Cartouche Forming a Bridge (Horizontal)", 1740.
1740. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-326-25.
